text: Wii Chess is a chess video game for the Wii console. It was developed by Nintendo and was released on January 18, 2008 in Europe as a budget-priced retail title.News: Nintendo gives out massive '08 schedule - ComputerAndVideoGames.com Under the name , it was released as a downloadable WiiWare title in Japan on September 30, 2008.Wii Chess Comes to WiiWare in Japan The game was never released in North America or Australia, making it the only game in the Wii series that was not released in those countries. It is also the only game in the series that do not have playable Mii characters. Wii Chess uses the Loop Express chess engine.Wii News: Wii Chess Screens - Official Nintendo Magazine ==Gameplay== The game is played using the Wii Remote. However, instead of the pointer function, chess pieces are moved across the board using the D-pad on the controller. The game features an option that gives players new to chess instructions on how each piece should move across the board. Players are also able to record and replay their games at a later time. Players can also play online against other players courtesy of the Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection, with Wii Chess players being able to compete against players of World Chess and vice versa.Nintendo.jp World Chess Wi-Fi overview ==Reception== Official Nintendo Magazine UK gave the game 78%. They praised the great online multiplayer and how the game plays a "perfect game". Their main criticisms were the bland visuals and the fact it will not capture the imaginations of people who do not like chess.Wii Review: Wii Chess - Official Nintendo Magazine Eurogamer gave the game 7/10, citing that it features a number of "sensible options", but notes that it misses features that would more than justify the price of the game.Wii Chess Review ==References== ==External links== *Official UK site *World Chess Japanese site Category:2008 video games Category:Chess software Category:Nintendo games Category:Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection games Category:Touch!
